verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> <WH8764>, A Psalm <WH4210> of David <WH1732>. How long wilt thou forget <WH7911> <WH8799> me, O YY <WH3068>? for ever <WH5331>? how long wilt thou hide <WH5641> <WH8686> thy face <WH6440> from me?

How long shall I take <WH7896> <WH8799> counsel <WH6098> in my soul <WH5315>, having sorrow <WH3015> in my heart <WH3824> daily <WH3119>? how long shall mine enemy <WH341> <WH8802> be exalted <WH7311> <WH8799> over me?
Consider <WH5027> <WH8685> and hear <WH6030> <WH8798> me, O YY <WH3068> my 'Elohim <WH430>: lighten <WH215> <WH8685> mine eyes <WH5869>, lest I sleep <WH3462> <WH8799> the sleep of death <WH4194>;
Lest mine enemy <WH341> <WH8802> say <WH559> <WH8799>, I have prevailed <WH3201> <WH8804> against him; and those that trouble <WH6862> me rejoice <WH1523> <WH8799> when I am moved <WH4131> <WH8735>.
But I have trusted <WH982> <WH8804> in thy mercy <WH2617>; my heart <WH3820> shall rejoice <WH1523> <WH8799> in thy salvation <WH3444>.
I will sing <WH7891> <WH8799> unto the YY <WH3068>, because he hath dealt bountifully <WH1580> <WH8804> with me.
